question: 高い
sourceMnemonic:
This is a single kanji with an <ja>い</ja> on the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>tall</kanji> or <kanji>expensive</kanji>? It's the same: <vocabulary>tall</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>expensive</vocabulary>. 

Weird that this word means both of these things, yeah? Just imagine money piled up to be really tall. That money is tall because it needs to buy something expensive.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

There's a <vocabulary>tall</vocabulary> dude trying to sell you something really <vocabulary>expensive</vocabulary>. He's really going off on how great this item is and how you should buy it. This guy is a real salesman. A real <reading>talker</reading> (<ja>たか</ja>).
